channel.title: Stremio News
channel.description: Latest news and updates from the Stremio Blog

item.title: Stremio Tech Update #71 – Android TV Updated
item.description: We just released v1.9.4 for Android TV, here’s what changed: Fixed disabling of subtitles not respected Fixed subtitles font size Fixed delays not being reset after changing tracks Fixed player type not being remembered Fixed images of catalogs not loading on old devices Fixed readability of tracks menus items Fixed incorrect time when opening in…

item.title: Stremio on MacOS – Notice of Issues
item.description: Due to a misunderstanding with Apple, the MacOS app signing certificate has been revoked which will cause an error message to show for users when attempting to open the Stremio MacOS app. We are currently in the process of appealing Apple’s actions and expect this issue to be resolved within 1-2 weeks. Contrary to the…

item.title: Stremio Tech Update #70 – Stremio Android TV Updated
item.description: We just released Stremio for Android TV v1.9.1 with the following changes: Updated player UI/UX Added a setting to display device clock on player Added an option to hide other languages from subtitles menu Added a setting to show title under catalog items Added internal player versions in settings about section Fixed missing background and…

item.title: Stremio (fully featured) Sideloadable IPA Release for iOS, iPadOS, Apple TV (tvOS)
item.description: While we are still waiting for Apple to answer in order to see if/when we will get back in Apple’s App Store with Stremio Lite, we decided to release the IPA files for Stremio (all features included, this supports all Android features, not just what Stremio Lite supported) officially from our downloads page. You can…

item.title: Stremio Tech Update #69 – Stremio v5 and Stremio Web Updated
item.description: Stremio v5 and Stremio Web were updated with the following changes: Show Streaming Server warning correctly Fix default title for addons type select Fix incorrect tab highlighting in Settings Fix metaDetails redirect when route ends with “/” Fix default title for addons type select Fix streams: copy stream link returns streamable url Addon install action…

item.title: We’re Back on Google Play
item.description: Stremio is now available on Google Play: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.stremio.one The app was suspended from Google Play for 19 days (since the 25th of December), and now we’re back! The android app continues to use the same app ID, so if you installed it from Google Play store before the December suspension, you will continue to get…

item.title: Happy New Year 2026!
item.description: Happy new year from the Stremio Team! It’s been an amazing year, as usual with ups and downs, yet always with more awesomeness than sorrow! For most of our team 2025 has passed and gone and we’re already planning for the future, while some of you may still be counting down the clock. We just…

item.title: Stremio Tech Update #68 – Stremio VR Updated on Meta Quest
item.description: We updated the Stremio VR app for Meta Quest, here’s what changed: Fixed addons sync issue where the Home page would sometimes not show all catalogs Fixed YouTube videos playing automatically when selecting the YouTube channel Fixed Discover page issues that would not show any items for some catalogs Fixed a memory leak during playback…

item.title: Stremio Tech Update #67 – Stremio Lite for iOS/MacOS Updated
item.description: We updated the Stremio Lite app for iOS and MacOS. Here’s what changed: Added Trakt login button Updated KSPlayer version Fixed Trakt events not being sent iOS specific: update app icon Retain previously selected TV show season Added subtitle styling settings Fixed trash bin icon on settings page for long Stremio server urls Changed the…

item.title: Stremio 2D Released to Meta Quest!
item.description: While we already released “Stremio VR” for Meta Quest back in April 2025, out of popular demand we also released “Stremio 2D” now for Meta Quest and it’s now available in the Meta Horizon Store! This is a windowed app that can be used for multi-tasking on the Meta Quest device. Here are some screenshots…
